gw.api.util

Class PhoneUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.util.PhoneUtil

  • public class PhoneUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides phone number validation and formatting routines. Based on Google's libphonenumber, basically proxying a lot of calls to libphonenumber for use in gosu.
    Author:
    cliu

    • Constructor Summary

      • findNumbersInText

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> findNumbersInText(java.lang.String input,
                                                                 PhoneCountryCode countryCode)
        Searches the input string for phone numbers, returns a list of phone numbers found in the String.
        Parameters:
        input - The input string to be parsed
        countryCode - The expected country code for the phone numbers
        Returns:
        A possibly empty list of found phone numbers.

      • convertAlphaCharacters

        public static java.lang.String convertAlphaCharacters(java.lang.String input)
        This method will convert alphanumeric characters into a numeric phone number. 1-800-CALL-SAM will convert 1-800-225-5726.
        Parameters:
        input - Input phone numbers containing alpha-numeric characters
        Returns:
        A fully numeric phone number

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(java.lang.String input,
                                      PhoneCountryCode phoneCountry)
        Formats a phone number string based on the country of origin
        Parameters:
        input - String of a phone number
        phoneCountry - Country of origin
        Returns:
        The formatted phone number if parseable

      • formatWithLocalizableExtension

        public static java.lang.String formatWithLocalizableExtension(java.lang.String input,
                                                              PhoneCountryCode phoneCountry)
        Formats, with localizable extensions, a phone number string based on the country of origin. Warning: this string may not be parsable back into a GWPhoneNumber object and should be used with care.
        Parameters:
        input - String of a phone number
        phoneCountry - Country of origin
        Returns:
        The formatted phone number if parsable

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(GWPhoneNumber phoneNumber,
                                      PhoneCountryCode viewingCountry)
        Format's a GWPhoneNumber object in the viewing country.
        Parameters:
        phoneNumber - The GWPhoneNumber object
        viewingCountry - The country from which you are viewing this phone number
        Returns:
        Returns a formatted string of the GWPhoneNumber object in the specified viewing country

      • formatForDialing

        public static java.lang.String formatForDialing(java.lang.String input,
                                                PhoneCountryCode phoneCountry,
                                                PhoneCountryCode originCountry)
        This will return a phone number suitable for dialing on a telephone. In most cases, phoneCountry would be the same as originCountry
        Parameters:
        input - String of phone number
        phoneCountry - Country of the phone number
        originCountry - Country of origin
        Returns:

      • formatWithLocalizableExtensionForDisplay

        public static java.lang.String formatWithLocalizableExtensionForDisplay(java.lang.String input,
                                                                        PhoneCountryCode phoneCountry,
                                                                        PhoneCountryCode originCountry)
        Formats the input based on the originCountry, which can be different than the parsing countryCode. This method allows for a localizable extension. Warning: The result may not be parsable back into a GWPhoneNumber
        Parameters:
        input -
        phoneCountry -
        originCountry -
        Returns:

      • isPossibleNumber

        public static boolean isPossibleNumber(java.lang.String input,
                                       PhoneCountryCode phoneCountry)
        Returns true if the string parameter is possibly a phone number. Is possible is a much looser check than isValid
        Parameters:
        input -
        phoneCountry -
        Returns:

      • isViableNumber

        public static boolean isViableNumber(java.lang.String value)
        Checks if a string can be a viable phone number. Will use IPhoneNormalizerPlugin if available, otherwise will check if the string contains a minimum set of digits required for a phone number and does not contain any extraneous characters outside of standard phone punctuations. This method is region independent. Is viable is even looser than isPossible.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        Whether or not the string is a viable phone number

      • isValidExtension

        public static boolean isValidExtension(java.lang.String value)
        Checks if the extension is less than 8 digits long.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        Whether or not the string is a valid extension

      • isViableNumberWithExtension

        public static boolean isViableNumberWithExtension(java.lang.String value)
        Checks if a string can be a viable phone number. Will use IPhoneNormalizerPlugin if available, otherwise will check if the string contains a minimum set of digits required for a phone number and does not contain any extraneous characters outside of standard phone punctuations. This method is region independent. Is viable is even looser than isPossible.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        Whether or not the string is a viable phone number

        second - Second GWPhoneNumber
        Returns:

      • getCountryFromRegionCode

        public static Country getCountryFromRegionCode(int regionCode)
        Converts a numeric region code to a Country typekey if possible. For the NANPA region, it will return US.
        Parameters:
        regionCode -
        Returns:
        A country typekey if it's a valid region code, otherwise it will return ZZ.

      • getPhoneCountryFromRegionCode

        public static PhoneCountryCode getPhoneCountryFromRegionCode(int regionCode)
        Converts a numeric region code to a PhoneCountryCode typekey if possible. For the NANPA region, it will return US.
        Parameters:
        regionCode -
        Returns:
        A country typekey if it's a valid region code, otherwise it will return ZZ.

      • normalize

        public static java.lang.String normalize(java.lang.String value)
        Normalizes a phone number, will use the IPhoneNormalizerPlugin if available. Otherwise will strip out all non-numeric characters with the exception of '+' or '*'.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        A normalized phone number

      • normalize

        public static java.lang.String normalize(java.lang.String value,
                                         boolean generateStackTraceOnError)
        Normalizes a phone number, will use the IPhoneNormalizerPlugin if available. Otherwise will strip out all non-numeric characters with the exception of '+' or '*'.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
        A normalized phone number
